funds.deadline: 2 weeks prior to proposed program date
funds.eligibility: Groups must be registered with SOLE. Individuals may also apply.
funds.about: Fund given to causes that support academic success of students. No non academic program allowed.
funds.improve_your_chances: Consider feasibility, cost efficiency, benefit for future students, necessity, impact of students

funds.deadline: 3 weeks prior to proposed program date.
funds.eligibility: Groups must be registered with SOLE. Individuals may also apply.
funds.about: Provides grants for student travel and accommodation during academic events. Only academic-specific travel will be allowed, no lobbying.
funds.improve_your_chances: All events that facilitate gathering for discussion, networking, training, academic or professional training qualify (ex. Interviews).

funds.deadline: Twice per quarter, mandatory hearing after application submission.
funds.about: Quarterly fund used to promote cultural diversity through arts. Funds facility and venue costs, program supplies, honorarium, and youth programs.
funds.improve_your_chances: Make sure you are promoting cultural awareness of marginalized communities, diversity, and art alongside related events.

funds.deadline: Fridays, 5 weeks prior to proposed program date.
funds.eligibility: Groups must be registered with SOLE. Individuals may also apply.
funds.about: Fund for students looking to advocate on behalf of themselves or organization for issues important to them.
funds.improve_your_chances: Advocacy must be on local/state/national/international issues or a core mission statement in the organizations bylaws/constitution.
funds.alert: Fund is now closed for Spring 2020

funds.deadline: Week 3 (Fall) or Week 4 (Winter and Spring) at 12 noon.
funds.eligibility: Groups must be registered with SOLE.
funds.about: Student program which contributes to the elimination of poverty and social problems; and/or provides direct services to disadvantaged groups.
funds.improve_your_chances: Innovation-as a response to the needs of the target population, uniqueness, professional services that address unmet needs, provide direct service

funds.deadline: Fixed per quarter, exact date varies depending on quarter.
funds.eligibility: Groups must be registered with SOLE.
funds.about: A supplemental funding source for student-initiated, student-run community service projects and UCLA student sponsoring organizations who perform outreach functions.
funds.improve_your_chances: The program or service to be implemented must be directly correlated towards increasing the academic competitiveness of socio-economically/educationally disadvantaged students and underrepresented communities towards eligibility or attendance to the University of California or other institutions of higher learning.
funds.alert: Fund is now closed for Spring 2020

funds.eligibility: Groups must be registered with SOLE and have physical office space in Kerckhoff Hall.
funds.about: Fund given to USAC office/commission or a student group with an office in Kerckhoff to cover cost of technology and furniture items.
funds.improve_your_chances: Consider the type of tech/furniture you are requesting. Computers, cabinents, desks, will be funded. Laptops, microwaves, etc. wonâ€™t.
funds.alert: Fund is now closed for Spring 2020

funds.deadline: 3 weeks prior to proposed program date.
funds.eligibility: Groups must be registered with SOLE.
funds.about: Helps student organizations fund activities and events which are desirable to the general interest of the UCLA Undergraduate Student Body.
funds.improve_your_chances: Food, retreats, parking, etc. will be funded.

funds.deadline: 2 Mondays prior to proposed program date.
funds.eligibility: Groups must be registered with SOLE.
funds.about: Help funds event organizing and supply costs for health-related events on-campus.
funds.improve_your_chances: Student orgs may apply multiple times, as long as each application is for a different event.

funds.deadline: 4 Weeks (for conferences) 2 Weeks (for programs and other funding needs)
funds.eligibility: Groups must be registered with SOLE. Individuals may also apply.
funds.about: Provide UCLA undergraduate students affiliated with a service project on-campus and UCLA student organizations the opportunity to pursue their service initiatives.
funds.improve_your_chances: Recipients of service include: UCLA students, Non-UCLA students, Non-human recipients (ex. Animals, Environment).
funds.alert: Fund is now closed until further notice.

funds.fund_org: The Green Initiative Fund (TGIF) Grant Application
funds.deadline: Fall: October 11, Winter: January 17 Spring: April 10
funds.eligibility: Groups must be registered with SOLE. Individuals may also apply.
funds.about: Projects/events that promote sustainability within the community
funds.improve_your_chances: Consider using sustainable materials at your events, such as compostable utensils, resuable tote bags, etc.

funds.fund_org: The Green Initiative Fund (TGIF) Grant Application
funds.eligibility: UCLA students, staff, and faculty; provided there is undergraduate student involvement and/or benefit.
funds.about: Projects/events that promote sustainability within the community
funds.improve_your_chances: Consider using sustainable materials at your events, such as compostable utensils, resuable tote bags, etc.

funds.deadline: Fall: October 8, 2019 Winter: November 5, 2019 Spring: February 18, 2020
funds.eligibility: Groups must be registered with SOLE.
funds.about: Fund to help programming costs of events organized and hosted by officially registered student organizations.
funds.improve_your_chances: Apply for funding towards advertising or graphics, facilities or equipment rentals, food, honoraria, props or costumes.
funds.alert: Fund is now closed for Spring 2020

funds.fund_org: Office of the Internal Vice President (IVP)
funds.deadline: Friday of Finals Week of Winter Quarter (March 20th, 2020).
funds.eligibility: Groups must be registered with SOLE. Individuals may also apply.
funds.about: Logistical support such as publicity, reserving spaces, and other opportunities to connect USAC with student organizations.
funds.improve_your_chances: Consider relevance, practicality, thrift, longevity, necessity, accessibility, and strength of your application.
funds.alert: Fund is now closed for Spring 2020

funds.eligibility: Groups must be registered with SOLE.
funds.about: To help alleviate some of the fiscal burdens student organizations face when putting on culturally relevant projects and events.
funds.improve_your_chances: Consider application thoroughness, applicant necessity, and program's benefit for the student body. Include cost estimates/quotes/documentation.
